articles.headline: Mueller Examining Trump’s Tweets in Wide-Ranging Obstruction Inquiry
articles.snippet: The president’s public attacks on Jeff Sessions and James Comey, which came as he was also privately pressuring them, are being scrutinized.
articles.abstract: The president’s public attacks on Jeff Sessions and James Comey, which came as he was also privately pressuring them, are being scrutinized.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, President Trump has used Twitter as his go-to public relations weapon, mounting a barrage of attacks on celebrities and then political rivals even after advisers warned he could be creating legal problems for himself.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Why Trump Is Right About the E.U.’s Penalty Against Google
articles.snippet: The European Union imposed a $5.1 billion penalty on Google last week. It is hard to find an antitrust expert who endorses the case’s logic or outcome.
articles.abstract: The European Union imposed a $5.1 billion penalty on Google last week. It is hard to find an antitrust expert who endorses the case’s logic or outcome.
articles.lead_paragraph: It didn’t take long last week for President Trump to blast America’s latest economic foe, the European Union, for imposing a $5.1 billion antitrust fine on Google’s parent company.

articles.headline: Hundreds Died in Syrian Custody, Government Acknowledges
articles.snippet: Syrian families have suddenly learned that missing relatives have been registered as dead by the government. Rights groups call it an admission that they were killed in prison.
articles.abstract: Syrian families have suddenly learned that missing relatives have been registered as dead by the government. Rights groups call it an admission that they were killed in prison.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Seven years ago, Islam Dabbas, an engineering student, was thrown in prison for protesting against the Syrian government. His mother visited him twice, paying bribes to do so, but then the permissions stopped. She heard nothing of her son’s fate ever since.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Karam Shoumali

articles.headline: Trump’s Trade Truce With Europe Has a Familiar Feel: It Mirrors Obama’s Path
articles.snippet: The president shelved his predecessor’s trade talks with Europe. Now, he wants to resume similar negotiations.
articles.abstract: The president shelved his predecessor’s trade talks with Europe. Now, he wants to resume similar negotiations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump called a truce with the European Union over trade, the general outlines of his plan sounded familiar. It echoed of earlier negotiations — the ones started under President Barack Obama and shelved by Mr. Trump last year.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Economy Hits a High Note, and Trump Takes a Bow
articles.snippet: Consumer spending helped yield a 4.1 percent growth rate in the quarter as tax cuts took hold. Businesses, while bullish, have shied from investing.
articles.abstract: Consumer spending helped yield a 4.1 percent growth rate in the quarter as tax cuts took hold. Businesses, while bullish, have shied from investing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tax cuts and federal spending are adding fuel to the already strong economy, putting the United States on a pace for its best year of growth in well over a decade.

articles.headline: Trump Owns the Booming Economy. Republicans on the Trail Barely Mention It.
articles.snippet: The new tax law was supposed to mobilize Republican voters and help the party keep the House, but that is not how it is playing out on the campaign trail.
articles.abstract: The new tax law was supposed to mobilize Republican voters and help the party keep the House, but that is not how it is playing out on the campaign trail.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWARK, Ohio — His Republican opponent doesn’t say much publicly about the Trump tax cuts, but on a warm night in a small-town union hall an hour outside Columbus, Danny O’Connor was happy to talk about them — a lot.

articles.headline: Disney and Fox Shareholders Approve Deal, Ending Corporate Duel
articles.snippet: Overseas regulators must still approve the deal, but the votes brought to a close a six-month battle waged across two continents by Disney and Comcast for supremacy in the media business.
articles.abstract: Overseas regulators must still approve the deal, but the votes brought to a close a six-month battle waged across two continents by Disney and Comcast for supremacy in the media business.
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: At Prayer Breakfast, Guests Seek Access to a Different Higher Power
articles.snippet: The annual event has become a hub of influence-peddling, as foreign dignitaries, religious leaders and lobbyists jockey for access to top American officials.
articles.abstract: The annual event has become a hub of influence-peddling, as foreign dignitaries, religious leaders and lobbyists jockey for access to top American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With a lineup of prayer meetings, humanitarian forums and religious panels, the National Prayer Breakfast has long brought together people from all over the world for an agenda built around the teachings of Jesus.
articles.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Elizabeth Dias
